Posts.Content: NIH is in Phase II of their study which started in 2011. Originally Posted by Otago I don't think waiting until early June is too long. Only about 3 extra months than you would have if you did early surgery. Regarding the laser ablation, I doubt you'll find anyone here who has done it for prostate cancer. I see a early 7 person trial for cancer. http://www.uchospitals.edu/news/2013...l-therapy.html Interesting concept.
Posts.Signature: dob 1956 58 DRE in 12/13 showed right lobe hard Biopsy 1/2014 positive 3 of 12 cores 1/10/14 3+6=6 20% 3+4=7 30% 3+3=6 50% psa 4.7 Clinical Stage T1c psa 4.07 8/30/13 psa 4.55 11/26/13 Abdomen CT normal Bone Scan normal
Posts.Title: Recently Diagnosed

Posts.Content: Another reluctant member of the club. My dad had PC at age 62, both his brothers had it. All still alive today. My dad is 82. So I was not surprised with the diagnosis. Just wasnt expecting it so soon. I have an appointment with Dr. Patel at Florida Hospital this week to find out about the surgical option. I also contacted NIH about their clinical trial for the MRI guided laser ablation. I met the first round of qualifications with my pathology results and will be going there in April for an MRI to see if I further qualify. I have to wait 10 to 12 weeks after my biopsy to allow the prostate heal for the before they will do the MRI When I meet with Dr Patel this week, I plan on scheduling the surgery for late May or June so I have time to finish with the qualifying at NIH. At this point that would be my preferred treatment. When I have all the facts, I make a final decision. A few questions.  Do you think waiting to June for surgery is too long of a wait?  Has anyone here had the Laser ablation and what were your results? Thanks

Posts.Title: Recently Diagnosed

Posts.Content: Thanks Lots of good information and a lot to read. I will go to NIH in April for an MRI and proceed from there. I did meet with Dr Patel and his team at Florida Hospital as a backup option, if necessary. If I do go for the surgical option, I have 100% confidence of having it done there.

Posts.Content: Ya, That is the big decision. Should I wait to June or not. I have an appointment with my urologist next week and my family doctor the following week. I will see what they have to say about waiting.
